title.narrative: Clean Air and Sustainable Environment Project

description.narrative: To improve air quality and safe mobility in Dhaka through the implementation of demonstration initiatives in urban transport and brick making

title.narrative: Continuous air monitoring stations providing air quality data in Bangladesh
Number of brick kilns adopting cleaner technology and decreasing (i) particulate emissions by 20% and (ii) GHG emission by 20% by end of project period
At least 2 cities with updated source / emissions profiles
Studies for (i) rationalization of bus route network (ii) BRT on a pilot corridor
Corridors of seperation of MV and NMV traffic
Intersections with new traffic signals installed and operational
New sidewalk with surface drainage constructed
Pedestrian using sidewalks in locations of intervention
Pedestrian using Foot Over Bridges in locations of interventions
Revised DTCB Act empowering DTCB presented to the Cabinet for approval

comment.narrative: Revised DTCB Act adopted by the parliament

title.narrative: Brick Burning Act drafted for Cabinet’s approval
Revised MV act for reduction in emissions submitted to the Cabinet

comment.narrative: Revised MV act adopted by the Parliament

title.narrative: Increase of vehicular traffic in location of interventions
Intersections with operational signals (including newly installed and existing fixed)
Clean Air Act drafted with stakeholder consultations and recommended to GoB for adoption
Complete study and implement key recommendations for better mobility of disabled people in one selected area in Dhaka
Vehicular traffic increased at selected intersections with operational traffic signals
